result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:21PM - (64-06) Defendant Bryan N Tidwell appeared by video.  Attorney Steven C. Harvey in court for Bryan N Tidwell.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Attorney Sempf in court. 
Attorney Harvey renews his objection to the Preliminary Hearing. Agrees to continue with the Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Response by Attorney Sempf.
Court notes Attorney Harvey's objections as stated at last hearing.
Court reviews the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver with the defendant.
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.


State to WRIT Bryan Tidwell for next hearing.

Adj. 2:39PM


Arraignment scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Original filed with Court

2:03PM - (64-06) Defendant Bryan N Tidwell not in court.  Attorney Steven C. Harvey in court for Bryan N Tidwell.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court in session for a Preliminary Hearing.
The State was unable to Writ the defendant over from Dodge Correctional, not enough time to get him here. The Court inquired to Dodge Correctional to have deft. appear via video. They were unable to have him appear on this date and time.
Attorney Harvey is requesting the court dismiss all four cases, Preliminary Hearing was to be within time limits.
Objection and response by ADA Herrmann.
Further argument by Attorney Harvey, client still demands in person and objects to anything else but in person.
Court on it's own motion will extend the matter for cause, facts stated on the record.
Court will extend time for  Preliminary Hearing to August 22, 2022 at 2PM. Defendant to appear either via WRIT if able to if not, video.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
**AMENDED TO REFLECT CORRECT COURT OFFICIAL.  CASE WILL REMAIN ASSIGNED TO JUDGE KOSS AFTER AUGUST 1, 2022.**

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bryan N Tidwell in court, in custody by video from DCI.  Attorney Steven C. Harvey in court for Bryan N Tidwell. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. State to prepare WRIT. Minutes filed.
Order for Representation - No Repayment at this Time
Proposed Order for Representation

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bryan N Tidwell not in court. Attorney Steve Compton appears specially. Defendant in custody, video was not able to be arranged. Video to be arranged for next hearing. Court appoints attorney due to SPD conflict. No repayment at this time. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22CF218, 21CF347, 21CF249, & 21CF175

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ANY CO-CONSPIRATORS. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bryan N Tidwell in court, in custody by video. Attorney Compton appears specially. Attorney Compton has resolution on Racine Co. cases and revocation. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
